page.title: 03The Forester's Year
page.content: The Forester raises his own seedling trees, sowing in seed beds for thinning in one to two years depending on ground conditions. Spring is spent planting (15-23 cm plants if rough planting or 10cm plants if in clean ploughing) and beating up (replacing failed plants). Summer is spent maintaining fences and weeding - grass, bracken, birch and rhododendron. In the Autumn new fences at 1.5m height are erected, hardwoods are planted and further weeding completed. Winter is for brashing and inspecting growing trees and continuing in association with the Gamekeeper the year round exercise of vermin control.
